clues.text: In this alliterative type of match, you need to touch your partner before you can be replaced in the ring
Maintaining kayfabe means not letting on that the match is this, the word that "kayfabe" possibly came from with the help of Pig Latin
This beastly term can describe a powerful embrace or a move where a wrestler grabs you
Perhaps a play on "jobber", this Italian-sounding word is a wrestler hired to lose often; the Rock uses it as a synonym for loser
The name of this masked Mexican wrestling is Spanish for "free fighting"
This nephew-killing title monarch is off to a slow start courting Lady Anne, who calls him "thou lump of foul deformity"
In "The Comedy of Errors", Dromio describes Nell: "Hip to hip: she is spherical, like" this name of Shakespeare's venue
In "Henry IV, Part 1" Falstaff disses a hostess: "There's no more faith in thee, than in a stewed" one of these fruits
King Lear tells this treacherous eldest daughter, "Thou art a boil, a plague-sore"
A line in this play: "If Troy be not taken till" Ajax & Achilles "undermine it, the walls will stand till they fall of themselves"
It's the northernmost of the 4 main islands of Japan
Moraine Lake is in this national park established in 1885 as Canada's very first
Catalan is the primary language of Catalonia & this small Pyrenees nation
Randburg & Midrand are suburbs of this chief commercial city of South Africa
The capital of a small Mediterranean island, it's where the Italian naval fleet surrendered to the Allies in 1943
Invisible to the naked eye, the closest star to our sun is the dim Proxima Centauri, a "red" one of these
Fittingly, New Hampshire is a source of this stone; the Swenson Quarry produces tons of it for street curbing
Aldebaran is the brightest star in this "bovine" constellation associated with a transformation made by Zeus
You might surmise from its name that sandstone is this one of the 3 classifications of rock
Deneb, the "tail" of the swan in this constellation, forms the "Summer Triangle" with Vega & Altair
An extra trap for a rabbit relative
The highest limit on a pants tariff
A frightening sprite from the flatlands of Kansas or Nebraska
The cost to ship a really big wooden box, determined by how heavy it is
The removed facial hair, now hallowed
David Copperfield had a standard magic trick where he made this happen to 13 audience members
Broadway theaters have at least 500 seats; off-Broadway ones tend to have 100 to 499 & these with a similar name, under 100
Partly to keep the audience awake, he kept the Ed Sullivan Theater at 55 degrees when taping his late-night show that ended in 2015
A Haydn symphony is nicknamed "Miracle" after the tale that one of these fell & smashed in a miraculously empty audience area
Putting down hecklers 1765-style, this Virginia orator responded to cries of "treason" with "If this be treason, make the most of it"
10-letter term for illegally smuggled stuff
Printed cotton handkerchief used as headwear
It can be a movement propelled by sheer momentum or something that literally conveys musicians
This nickname for a slot machine that dates back to the 1930s sounds like someone who is about to rob you
Lewis Carroll's "frumious" creature
It precedes "bean" in something you may enjoy & precedes "stone" in something you very much would not
It's the organ that's often contrasted with brawn
This protein- & iron-rich chicken part in "chopped" form is also in a common rhetorical question
Speak with one of these, also found in some snakes' mouths, & your intent is to deceive
Synonyms for this word, also an organ, include vesicle, sac & pouch
Friedrich Froebel started the first of these schools in Germany in 1837 & started the day with merry songs
In 1783 Poland was the first country to ban this in schools; it's also banned in the country's constitution
Golfer Terry Williams was the USA's first woman to receive one of these, from the University of Miami in 1973
The USA's first public teacher training school evolved into Framingham State University in this state
In 1761 Claude Bourgelat, who wrote "Sur la m√©decine des chevaux", set up the first school for this profession
This dog "Come-Home" first appeared as a 1938 Saturday Evening Post story; a novel followed, then radio, movies & TV
This sci-fi great teamed with Robert Silverberg to expand his classic 1941 short story "Nightfall" into a 1990 novel
Jonathan Safran Foer expanded his short story "The Very Rigid Search" into the novel "Everything is" this
"Big Creek Missile Agency", Homer Hickam's article about his childhood, became this book that became the movie "October Sky"
First a short story, this Jeffrey Eugenides novel about 5 sisters who die young became a Sofia Coppola film
The HT in HTML & HTTP stands for this
In the Disney film he's alphabetically last of Snow White's seven dwarfs
A flock of geese in flight can be called a skein or wedge; the same group on the ground or in the water is this
This appetizer has flowered on the Outback Steakhouse menu since 1988--it accounts for 1 in 4 apps ordered there
Andrew Lloyd Webber wrote the music to the songs in "Jesus Christ Superstar"; this man wrote the lyrics

Often unpopular on a diamond:
IMPURE

He sometimes runs the football:
FLAB HACK

A big shot in basketball:
HERE TO RIP NET

Multi-gender tennis:
EDIBLE MUD SOX

Olympic event with ropes & ribbons:
CATCHY STRING SHIMMY

rounds.text: The name of this Ohio city comes from a Greek word meaning "high"
